column1: Twelve years before the town of Lenexa was platted
column2: James Butler Hickok staked a claim on 160 acres (65 ha) at what is now the corner of 83rd and Clare Road. Filed in 1857
column3: the claim was not far from the Kansas River
column4: and was 20 miles (32 km) southwest of Westport
column6: and the start of the Santa Fe Trail. The trail meandered through this area on its way to Santa Fe

column4: Hickok became a scout for the Free-State Army
column6: one of the most famous folk heroes of the American West

column1: Lenexa is the home of a Records Center managed by the National Archives and Records Administration.  The facility stores federal records from agencies in Iowa
column4: and Nebraska including Department of Veterans Affairs and the Internal Revenue Service. The facility is also known informally as "The Caves" and is known to store items from the trauma room at Parkland Memorial Hospital in Dallas
column6: where John F. Kennedy was pronounced dead following his assassination. As of January 2020
column7: the current Mayor of Lenexa is Michael Boehm and the current City Manager is Beccy Yocham.

column1: Lenexa does not have a public school district of its own. Instead
column2: Lenexa students go to either Shawnee Mission School District
column4: or De Soto School District schools. It is also home to a handful of private schools. Lenexa's first private high school
column6: opened in 2005. The Johnson County Library had a branch in Lenexa
column7: the Lackman Library. Wichita based Friends University also has a branch in Lenexa
column8: as does Brown Mackie College. The International Assembly for Collegiate Business Education is based in Lenexa; its competitive peer
column9: the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs
column10: is based in neighboring Overland Park.

column1: Each June the city hosts "The Great Lenexa Barbecue Battle"
column2: which is also the Kansas State Championship. Lenexa was known as the "Spinach Capital of the World" in the 1930s and celebrates with the Spinach Festival every September.

column1: Lenexa is home to the St. George Serbian Orthodox Church
column2: a parish founded in Kansas City in 1906 and moved to Lenexa in 2006. The parish constructed a new Byzantine style church and cultural center. The church hosts a SerbFest every year in the summer and a Food Festival and Bazaar in the fall.
an evangelical Protestant denomination which was headquartered for many years in Kansas City
column3: moved its international headquarters to Lenexa in 2008.
